name: 丁秀儀
objective: The purpose of this course is to familiarize students with frequently used statistical methods and theories. Students will be able to draw appropriate conclusions through problem identification, data collection, and appropriate statistical analysis methods. The course includes: descriptive statistics, probability concepts, probability distribution, interval estimation, hypothesis test, variance analysis, and regression analysis.
schedule:
9. Hypothesis Tests.
10. Inference about Means and Proportions with Two Populations.
11. Inferences about Population Variances.
12. Comparing Multiple Proportions, Test of Independence and Goodness of Fit.
13. Experimental Design and Analysis of Variance.
14. Simple Linear Regression.
15. Multiple Regression.
16. Regression Analysis: Model Building.
scorePolicy:
10% Max[Assignment, Kahoot!]
20% Quizzes
30% Final exam
10% Mid-term report
30% Final report
materials: David R. Anderson, Dennis J. Sweeney, Thomas A. Williams, Jeffrey D. Camm, James J. Cochran, Statistics for Business & Economics, 2013.
consultation: If you have any further questions, please email me.
remarks: Course handouts and important information are available on Microsoft Teams.We will use Microsoft Teams to deliver online classes for the pandemic.
